sentence.text: She was first referred to hospital for “developmental delay”.
She was unable to sit or crawl at the age of eight months and she could not walk until 18 months.
Her joint mobility was normal and she had occult cleft in lumbosacral vertebral lamina.
At the age of ten months, she was 63 cm high (− 3.63 SD) and her head circumference was 45.5 cm (41.9 percentile).
Her arm span was 61 cm and sitting height was 40.5 cm.
In addition, dolichosigmoid and triangular face were also noticed.
During her last visit in the age of 2 years, her height was 74 cm (− 3.83 SD) and her weight was 8.5 kg (< 0.1 percentile).
Her head circumference was 47 cm (41 percentile) and arm span was 71.5 cm.
Her intelligence was normal by the time we last evaluated.
Endocrine tests were normal, including thyroid function, growth hormone stimulation tests, insulin-like growth factor (IGF)-1 and IGF-binding protein-3 tests.
